org.spongepowered.api.scoreboard

Interface Team


  • public interface Team
    A team on a scoreboard that has a common display theme and other properties.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addUser(User user)
      Adds the specified User to this team for the Scoreboard.
      boolean allowFriendlyFire()
      Gets whether friendly fire is enabled.
      boolean canSeeFriendlyInvisibles()
      Gets whether invisible team members are shown.
      TextColor getColor()
      Gets the color of this team.
      Visibility getDeathTextVisibility()
      Gets the Visibility which controls who death Texts for players on this team are visible to.
      Text getDisplayName()
      Gets the name displayed to users for this team.
      String getName()
      Gets the name of this team.
      Visibility getNameTagVisibility()
      Gets the Visibility which controls to who nametags of players on this team are visible to.
      Text getPrefix()
      Gets the prefix prepended to the display name of users on this team.
      Set<Scoreboard> getScoreboards()
      Returns a Set of parent Scoreboards this Team is registered to.
      Text getSuffix()
      Gets the suffix appended to the display name of users on this team.
      Set<User> getUsers()
      Gets the Users on the team.

      Removes the specified User from this team.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Gets the name of this team.
        Returns:
        The name of this team

      • getDisplayName

        Text getDisplayName()
        Gets the name displayed to users for this team.
        Returns:
        The display name for this team

      • getColor

        TextColor getColor()
        Gets the color of this team.

        The team's color is a distinct concept from its prefix or suffix. It is only used for colored sidebar display slots, and certain statistic criteria.

        Returns:
        The team color

      • setColor

        void setColor(TextColor color)
       throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the color of this team.

        The team's color is a distinct concept from its prefix or suffix. It is only used for colored sidebar display slots, and certain statistic criteria.

        Parameters:
        color - The team color
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If color is TextColors.RESET

      • setDisplayName

        void setDisplayName(Text displayName)
             throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the name displayed to users for this team.
        Parameters:
        displayName - The Text to use
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If displayName is longer than 32 characters

      • getPrefix

        Text getPrefix()
        Gets the prefix prepended to the display name of users on this team.
        Returns:
        The prefix for this team

      • setPrefix

        void setPrefix(Text prefix)
        throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the prefix prepended to the display name of users on this team.
        Parameters:
        prefix - The new prefix for this team
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If prefix is longer than 16 characters

      • getSuffix

        Text getSuffix()
        Gets the suffix appended to the display name of users on this team.
        Returns:
        The team's current suffix

      • setSuffix

        void setSuffix(Text suffix)
        throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the suffix appended to the display name of users on this team.
        Parameters:
        suffix - The new suffix for this team.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If suffix is longer than 16 characters

      • getUsers

        Gets the Users on the team.
        Returns:
        The Users on the team

      • addUser

        void addUser(User user)
        Adds the specified User to this team for the Scoreboard.

        This will remove the User from any other team on the Scoreboard.

        Parameters:
        user - The User to add

      • removeUser

        boolean removeUser(User user)
        Removes the specified User from this team.
        Parameters:
        user - The User to remove
        Returns:
        Whether the User was on this team

      • getScoreboards

        Set<Scoreboard> getScoreboards()
        Returns a Set of parent Scoreboards this Team is registered to.
        Returns:
        A Set of parent Scoreboards this Team is registered to
